title: Keisha Lance Bottoms
summary: Keisha Lance Bottoms (born January 18, 1970)[1] is an American lawyer and politician who is the 60th mayor of Atlanta, Georgia. She was elected mayor in 2017. Before becoming mayor, she was a member of the Atlanta City Council, representing part of Southwest Atlanta.[2] President Joe Biden nominated Bottoms as vice chair of civic engagement and voter protection at the DNC for the 2021â€“2025 term.[3]
